Key Match Events: Sacramento Kings overwhelmed the Boston Celtics in the fourth quarter, cruising to a 114-97 victory
Others: Domantas Sabonis put up his 33rd and 15th straight double-double with averages of 22.0 points and 19.6 rebounds in his last three games
DeMar DeRozan’s offense is starting to ignite, with three 24+ point games in his last four
Malik Monk has been thriving in the point guard spot, reaching 20+ points in five straight games
Keegan Murray’s rebounding has been up-and-down lately
Trey Lyles’ scoring has gone cold, with three straight games under double digits
Jaylen Brown’s offense has been erratic in recent games since coming back from a shoulder injury
Kristaps Porzingis has been playing incredibly well, almost recording three straight 20-point, 10-rebound games
Jrue Holiday’s offense has been lacking, with only one strong scoring game in his last six
Derrick White’s offense and overall contributions have been trending down
Payton Pritchard has cooled off significantly, missing a lot of threes and averaging a mere 5.2 points in four of his last five games
